metadata.title: CVE-2018-5150 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Firefox 59, Firefox ESR 52.7, andThunderbird 52.7. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort that some of these could beexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird <52.8, Thunderbird ESR < 52.8, Firefox < 60, and Firefox ESR < 52.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
